places_to_visit.name: Christ the Redeemer
places_to_visit.description: Christ the Redeemer is an iconic statue of Jesus Christ located on Corcovado Mountain in Rio de Janeiro. Standing 30 meters tall, the statue overlooks the city and offers panoramic views of Rio’s stunning landscape. It is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

places_to_visit.name: Sugarloaf Mountain
places_to_visit.description: Sugarloaf Mountain is a famous peak in Rio de Janeiro known for its panoramic views of the city and the surrounding bay. Visitors can take a cable car ride to the top for breathtaking vistas of Rio’s coastline, beaches, and the Christ the Redeemer statue.

places_to_visit.name: Copacabana Beach
places_to_visit.description: Copacabana Beach is one of Rio de Janeiro's most famous beaches, known for its golden sand, lively atmosphere, and beautiful views of the Atlantic Ocean. The beach is a popular spot for sunbathing, swimming, and enjoying the vibrant beachside culture.

places_to_visit.name: Ipanema Beach
places_to_visit.description: Ipanema Beach is another iconic beach in Rio, famous for its upscale neighborhood and cultural significance. The beach is known for its clean sand, clear water, and vibrant beach scene, with numerous bars, restaurants, and shops lining the shore.
